result.execSummary:
The defendant Avelino Manuel Roque was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs and Department of Corrections Supervision fees. Court costs are paid in full.
-------------------

No contact with the victim. Not to possess any other persons personal identifying documents. No alcohol. No drugs or drug paraphernalia.
-------------------
Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

timeConds.notes:
The Defendant is to serve ninety (90) days in the Walworth County Jail with work release privileges to commence on or before September 28, 2022 @ 8:00 a.m. NOTE: Defendant is to report to jail on time and with no detectable amount of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Failure to comply will result in revocation of work release privileges for a period of five (5) days, unless reinstated by the Court.
-------------------
IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.

3:20 PM (64-06) Defendant Avelino Manuel Roque in court. with Spanish Interpreter Laura Salcido, previously sworn by the clerk.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin Viven TenHaken in court.  Attorney Sylvie Dahnert in court for Avelino Manuel Roque. 
State called to the stand as a witness, Lt. Ryan Taft of Whitewater.
Ryan Taft duly sworn by the clerk and testified on direct examination by ADA TenHaken.
Witness has identified the defendant in Court. Exhibit #1 marked, identified and discussed.
Exhibit #1 offered and received by the Court.
3:23 PM - Cross examination by Attorney Dahnert.
Evidence is closed.
3:29 PM - Argument by the State requesting defendant be bound over.
3:30 PM - No argument by Attorney Dahnert.
Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and that the defendant likely committed it and binds him over to stand trial on the charges.
State is requesting a few weeks for Arraignment date. Attorney Dahnert is requesting today.
Attorney Dahnert waived time limits to set Arraignment Hearing.

Court will set Arraignment date out a few weeks.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Avelino Manuel Roque appeared in court, with the assistance of Spanish Interpreter, Saul Arteaga. Attorney Leah Selmek appeared in court for Avelino Manuel Roque, Plaintiff State of Wisconsin appeared in court by JJ Crawford. Called @ 2:27 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for initial appearance. Charges, penalties explained by the Court. Atty. Selmek requests preliminary hearing and waives time limits. Matter set for preliminary hearing. Court in recess.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH A.C.H. OR THE VICTIMS THAT THE DEFENDANT HAS THEIR PERSONAL IDENTIFYING INFORMATION.Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 

22-933 & 22-934

Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Avelino Manuel Roque appeared in court, in custody by video with Attorney Tony Kim and interpreter St. John. Defendant does qualify for SPD attorney. State asking for $10,000 cash. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
